sentences.en: A spokesman has said they were not an attempt to mislead.
sentences.cn: 发言人说他们没又企图误导.

sentences.en: Also, I'm loath to talk rubbish that will mislead the younger generation.
sentences.cn: 也不愿胡说八道而误人子弟.

sentences.en: Arcing balls are inclined to mislead umpires to incorrect judgements.
sentences.cn: 弧线球易使裁判产生错误判断.

sentences.en: Critics accuse companies of using ads to mislead us.
sentences.cn: 批评者指责公司滥用广告误导我们.

sentences.en: Don’t be misled by appearances, he’s a good worker.
sentences.cn: 不要被表象迷惑，他工作干得挺不错的。

sentences.en: Don't let his friendly manner mislead you into trusting him.
sentences.cn: 不要让他那种友好的态度使你误信他.

sentences.en: Don't let his friendly words mislead you.
sentences.cn: 别让他那友好的言词把你蒙混住.

sentences.en: His random , elliptical, occasionally emotional manner of conversation was bound to shock, and mislead, the historians.
sentences.cn: 他谈话时漫无边际, 藏头掩尾, 间或感情冲动的特点,必定会使历史学家们感到吃惊和引起他们的误解.

sentences.en: Jack, mislead by bad companion, get into the drug habit.
sentences.cn: 在坏伙伴的诱使下, 杰克染上了吸毒癖.

sentences.en: Macdonald accepted that such information could be used to manipulate, to obfuscate, and to mislead.
sentences.cn: 麦克唐纳相信这样的信息可以用来操纵舆论，蒙蔽误导。

sentences.en: Many false prophets will arise and will mislead many.
sentences.cn: 太24:11且有好些假先知起来、惑多人.

sentences.en: Many politicians tried to mislead voters during the election.
sentences.cn: 许多政治人物在选举期间试著误导选民.

sentences.en: Ministers must not knowingly mislead Parliament and the public.
sentences.cn: 大臣们不应该故意地误导议会与公众。

sentences.en: Please do not mislead yourself by the existing condition of your plant.
sentences.cn: 不要被工厂目前的表面现象所误导.

sentences.en: They are unfair to the famous and mislead the public.
sentences.cn: 那些不实的报导不仅对名人不公平,也会误导大众.

sentences.en: With so many reports to mislead one, it is hard to say at whose door the responsibility should be laid.
sentences.cn: 报告多得摸不着头绪, 很难说责任该由谁负.

words.tran_cn: 令人误解的；引入歧途的
错误引导者；错误领导人
给…带错路；把…引入歧途（mislead的ing形式）

trans.tran_en: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete

trans.tran_cn: 给…错误印象， 使误解； 把…带错路； 使误入歧途
trans.tran_en: to make someone believe something that is not true by giving them information that is false or not complete
